page.title: 12Farming in Bearley
page.content: Over the past decade many changes have occureed in bearley. Land has been swallowed up into enormous units and two large estates now farm much of the area around Bearley once comprising of 12 indiviudal farms. Hedges and ditches have been torn up and drained creating large prairie type field with obsolete houses converted into private dwellings and holiday flats. During the War 500 acres of woodland was felled and the land converted into an airfield. This subsequently reverted to agriculture privately farmed in conjunction with a British Telecom Radio Station now in the process of closing. Small plots of land have been sold as pony paddocks and extended gardens by enterprising farmers and one holding converted into the local Gypsy Site.
